page.title: 16St. Levan Women's Institute
page.content: St. Levan Women's Institute meetings are held on the{second {Tuesday in each month}at 7.30 p.m. in the Methodist Schoolroom. The Committee meets on the first Tuesday in each month. Mrs. Jean Williams, Roskestal Farm, told us about{talks they have on subjects like First aid, Astrology or converting cottages. {Competitions}such as decorating an egg or a poem on "Star and Sky." are also held. 1985 is the{50th. anniversary}of St. Levan W.I. They are going to have {a special dinner to celebrate.}Each meeting starts with a song called "Jerusalem". This was written by a famous poet called William Blake. They have 22 members. They do not enter the {W.I. competitions at Royal Cornwall {Show}as it is too far to travel to Wadebridge. Treen and Penberth have a separate branch - see page 17.
